about.title: About
summary: I'm a Data & Automation Engineer who turns fragmented product and revenue data into clear insight. My focus is modeling, orchestration, and automation—so teams can trust metrics and ship decisions faster.

I work primarily in BigQuery with modern analytics engineering patterns. I design entity-centric models (e.g., account, product, subscription) and build dashboards that reveal activation, engagement, and monetization.
Beyond modeling, I automate the boring but critical parts—backfills, data quality checks, and refresh schedules—so stakeholders see fresh, reliable numbers every day.
focusAreas: Data modeling in BigQuery; entity-first schemas

projects.intro: Selected work across analytics engineering, automation, and serverless observability.

items.title: Copilot Analytics Platform
items.summary: Unified analytics across CopilotApps, Threads, Messages, DataSources, Integrations, and Subscriptions to measure creation, activation, engagement, and revenue.
items.problem: Product data lived in multiple operational tables with inconsistent keys and definitions, making it hard to see a clean user journey per account.
items.approach: Modeled a central entity (account) and joined Copilot app datasets (apps, threads, messages, integrations, data sources, subscriptions). Added UTM & device context for acquisition analysis and message counts by surface type.
items.outcome: Three-level dashboard (overall, company-level, UTM view) enabling growth, product, and support teams to align on shared KPIs.

items.title: Revenue Analytics with Stripe → BigQuery
items.summary: Modeled multi-level revenue insights by product and organization using Stripe subscription and pricing data.
items.problem: Finance and product teams needed unified visibility into subscriptions, plans, prices, and transactions across products.
items.approach: Joined organizations, productAccounts, products, subscriptions, plans, prices, and transactions to build incremental, denormalized marts for reporting.
items.outcome: A Console dashboard providing plan-level and product-level views with reliable MRR/ARR breakdowns.

items.title: Console Dashboard across 9 Tables
items.summary: Console dashboard integrating products, productMetrics, plans, planMetrics, subscriptions, subscriptionMetrics, transactions, prices, and productAccounts.
items.problem: Stakeholders needed a single pane of glass for plan and subscription health without switching tools.
items.approach: Created standardized views with consistent time grains and entity keys; defined clear metric contracts.
items.outcome: Self-serve analytics across products and subscriptions with minimal ad‑hoc SQL requests.

items.title: Boltic Serverless Observability
items.summary: Unified analytics for serverless artifacts—Apps, Builds, Domains, Jobs, Namespaces, Releases, and schema_migrations.
items.problem: Operational visibility across serverless entities was fragmented, slowing down diagnosis and planning.
items.approach: Modeled joins across serverless reference tables and built entity-centric reports with drilldowns.
items.outcome: Faster triage and a clearer view of release cadence, stability, and platform usage.

items.title: Unified Copilot Journey Pipeline
items.summary: Mapped end-to-end user journey per account: creation, activation, integrations, deployments, threads, messages, and data sources.
items.problem: Teams needed a single, trustworthy sequence of events per account to align activation metrics with usage.
items.approach: Created resilient joins on accountid, standardized timestamps (using TIMESTAMP('1970-01-01') as a sane fallback), and added status flags for active/inactive threads.
items.outcome: Consistent journey definitions powering product and success dashboards.

items.title: Subscription & Plan Insights
items.summary: Entity-level insights into plan adoption using joins across product accounts, plans, and subscriptions.
items.problem: It was unclear which plans were adopted most and how plan mixes affected revenue and engagement.
items.approach: Standardized plan and subscription dimensions, filtered out Free plans when necessary, and built plan cohort views.
items.outcome: Clarity on plan performance to guide packaging and pricing experiments.
